input.label:
# GIC Collect 1.0.14
### Markdown
This is the current status of the markdown implementation.
The following markdown tags work at label, hint and options, except those in italics and in parentheses:
- Headings - Font colors - Choices label formatting - Cursive text - New Lines - Emphasis bold - Emphasis italic - Emphasis bold and italic - Underline italic - Monospace - Clickable link - Bullets in a title - A combinacion of several formatting - Hint formatting - Blockquotes - Nested blockquotes - Unordered lists - Local Image - Remote image - Quick url and email
![](file:///giclogo.png)
# . ## .

# Test Document ### About This is our port of the open data kit collect for IOS. Most of the functions are available. The forms developed for odk should work mostly without changes. We have been developing and testing this port for quite some time. Objectives for this version - Large compatibility of forms with ODK Collect - Connect for upload and download of data and forms to ODK Aggregate - Languages english and spanish - Usage for the main cases. If you are a heavy or pro user or an NGO, Government, School, University or any other institution that needs to use this app please contact us with your needs and we'll try to help you any way we can. ### Contact Please contact me in any one of the methods below if you have questions or comments. If you'd like to review the app please drop me a line and I'll shoot you a promo code. Other than that, please enjoy the app! Email:
Linkedln: [Daniel Salazar](https://linkedin.com/in/daniel-salazar-0009742) ![Gic](file:///giclogo.png) # . # .
# -Introduction
input.hint:
Formatting can be used for labels and hints to change the presentation of ODK Collect,

This example was created using XLSForms.These examples show the effect of formatting in the **Label** and the syntax used is shown in the **Hint** . Both Markdown and or HTML have been used.

The formatting used on this page will be demonstrated in the following examples.

**IMPORTANT** in the following examples a ~  or \\ symbols are placed before the actual Markdown syntax to stop it having effect; remove all of the  ~ or \\ symbols in the actual code!

input.label: # Heading level 1 ## Heading level 2 ### Heading level 3 #### Heading level 4 ##### Heading level 5 ###### Heading level 6
input.hint:
~# Heading level 1
~## Heading level 2
~### Heading level 3
~#### Heading level 4
~##### Heading level 5
~###### Heading level 6

input.label: ###### Going Small
input.hint:
~###### Going Small

the number of hashes used reduces the size.

input.label: Going red
input.hint: Going <*span style="color:red">red<*/span>

input.label: Going green
input.hint:
Going <*span style="color:green">green<*/span>

You can try this with other colours; most primary colours should work.

select1.label: Formatting works on labels for Choices also

input.label: Cursive text
input.hint: <*span style="font-family:cursive">Cursive text<*/span>

input.label: # Large cursive text
input.hint:
~# <*span style="font-family:cursive">Large cursive text<*/span>

You can combine formatting; here Markdown for LARGE has been combined with HTML for CURSIVE.

input.label:
New

Lines A new line also works
input.hint:
New<*br><*br>Lines A new line also works

This formatting has been used in many of the preceeding examples already.

input.label:
# Emphasis - Bold
This example can be appreciated in the hint, because the label is already bold.
input.hint:
I just love **bold text**.
Love **is** bold
I just love \*\*bold text\*\*. <*br> Love \*\*is\*\* bold Add two asterisks or underscores before and after a word or phrase.

input.label:
# Emphasis - Italics
Italicized text is the *cat's meow*. A *cat* meow
This example can be appreciated in the label, because the hint is already Italic.
input.hint:
Italicized text is the \*cat's meow\*. <*br> A \*cat\* meow
Add one asterisk or underscore before and after a word or phrase.

input.label:
# Emphasis - Bold and italic
This example can be appreciated in the hint.
input.hint:
This text is ***really important***.
This text is \*\*\*really important\*\*\*.
Add three asterisks or underscores before and after a word or phrase.

input.label: Underline Italic
input.hint:
<*u>Underline<*/u> <*i>Italic<*/i>

Two HTML examples of some basic formatting.

input.label: Using Monospace font
input.hint:
<*span style="font-family:monospace">Using Monospace font<*/span>

This will work for fonts that are supported by your device, so use with care.

input.label: [clickable link](https://nafundi.com/blog/posts/customize-odk-forms-with-fonts-colors-sizes-and-links/)
input.hint:
~[clickable link]~(https://nafundi.com/blog/posts/customize-odk-forms-with-fonts-colors-sizes-and-links/)

A lot of the examples shown here have been taken directly from the great resource provided by Nafundi, so it's only right that when demonstrating a clickable link, the link is back to their resource.

input.label:
..*Bullets
..*In a title?
input.hint: ..*Bullets<*br>..In a title?

input.label:
Putting     IT     *all*  
to get her
input.hint:
<*span style="color:red">P<*/span><*span style="color:green">u<*/span><*span style="color:yellow">tt<*/span><*span style="color:blue"><*i>ing<*/span><*/i> <*span style="font-family:cursive">IT<*/span>*all* <*br><*u>to<*span style="color:red">get<*/span><*span style="color:ble"><*/u>her<*/span>



Too much?

input.label: Formatting in hints works also
input.hint: As Shown   here

input.label: > Blockquotes
input.hint:
\>Blockquotes
To create a blockquote add a > in front of a paragraph.

input.label:
> Blockquotes
>> Nested blockquote
input.hint:
\> Blockquotes <*br>   \>\> Nested blockquote
Add a   >>   in front of the paragraph you want to nest

input.label: Unordered lists
input.hint:
Whatever
- First item
- Second item
- Third item
- Fourth item
